data.text: @Claudia_Sahm @Michael_Cobb68 @EmilyRPeck It's kind of shame on us because we have been warned. From oil embargoes to 4 dollar a gallon gas under Bush. We're starting to hit that F around and find out phase about our love for oil.😬
@Claudia_Sahm @Michael_Cobb68 @EmilyRPeck Honestly, I don't see anything that's going to benefit people in the short term other than rationing trips and working from home if you can.
@Claudia_Sahm @Michael_Cobb68 @EmilyRPeck Shamelessly advocating for green technology like the oil lobby is Shamelessly advocating for drilling everywhere.
@Michael_Cobb68 @hoodedchef @EmilyRPeck tell me what the realistic solutions are. please, I will share them.

@Michael_Cobb68 @Claudia_Sahm @EmilyRPeck They do what's cost-effective. There is a limit to what they will even pay in gas. You don't get rich by throwing money into a fire pit. In this case hundreds of dollars into a turbo diesel or some other gas burner. During the last gas hike, people bought fewer big vehicles.

@hoodedchef @Claudia_Sahm @EmilyRPeck Of course! The rich can do almost anything! Yet, they don't do what you want them to.

I'm asking for realistic scenarios, not cheering on a fantasy land that isn't going to happen. My questions were dodged.
@smhten @PshawYsm @EmilyRPeck @Claudia_Sahm Yes, alot of morons on the streets.
@hoodedchef @Michael_Cobb68 @EmilyRPeck you might like the third idea in my post ... https://t.co/uUdebm7Ku1
